message.content:
cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.PF 

This paper deals with optimizing the energy efficiency of 5G networks through the use of Advanced Sleep Modes (ASM), which involves modeling the system as a Markov Decision Process (MDP) and finding optimal sleep policies. This topic is closely related to the field of computer networks (cs.NI) and systems and control (cs.SY), as well as information theory (cs.IT) and distributed computing (cs.DC) which are relevant for designing efficient communication protocols and algorithms. Additionally, the paper discusses the impact of a switching component on the energy reduction versus delay trade-off, which is related to power and energy optimization (cs.PF).
